author: Ted Byrne
content:
I'm puzzled by your lead image. It leaves me with a feeling that it is fighting with the dimensions of the 35mm frame. It leaves me searching for point, a statement, an idea. Is it the antagonism between the romantic utopian bucolic moment and the deliberate geometry of the power highways? Maybe antagonism is the wrong word? Could there be beauty in the creations of those engineers? We know that there is beauty in the radiant vista. Hmmmmm....

I get it, as a lover of music you have created a cacophonic chord which combines individually satisfying elements that clatter against one another.

Lemme ask you... was there a concern in you when you composed this about the way nature makes modernism... ugly ðŸ™‚
